dict.string: This sample shows you how to display a map with imagery basemap
This sample shows you how to customize map view's background grid
This sample shows how to tell what the map's load status is
This sample shows you how to open a map using its url
Changing the basemap is too easy. This sample shows you how it can be done
You can also specify an area or enveloper as the initial view for the map to start with
You can set the initial location for a map by passing in the coordinates and the zoom level
You can initialize a map by specifying the spatial reference. If you add any layer with a different spatial reference it will re-project
This sample shows you how to manage layers in a map. You can reorder them, delete an existing layer or insert a new layer
Now you can add and view bookmarks on a map
Every time the map is drawing you get an update using the callbacks
You can get the view status for each layer in your map. It tells you if the that layer is currently active or not currently visible or if an error occured while loading it etc
You can change the viewpoint of a map view and there are different ways you can do this. You can use a geometry or a point, etc. with or without animation
This sample shows you how to rotate a map view. You can pinch to rotate or do it programmatically.
You can tap and hold on the map to get a magnifier
You can start the location display on the map view to get current location updates. There are different auto pan modes you can switch between, namely, re-center mode, navigation mode or compass mode
You can now take a screenshot of the map view. You can use it as the thumbnail for you newly created map or simply share it with your co-workers
With the new APIs you get to author a map on you mobile device. You can create a map by adding a basemap and one or more operational layers and save it to your portal
You can tap on map and get all the elements present at that location from different layers
This sample shows how to open a mobile map from a mobile map package
This sample shows how to search and route using data in a map package
Honor mobile map package expiration date
Access the expiration information of an expired mobile map package.
This sample demonstrates how to generate an offline map for web map in ArcGIS Portal. The sample requires login to take AGOL Basemap offline.
Override the default parameters when taking a map from ArcGIS Portal offline.
Take a web map offline, but instead of downloading an online basemap, use one which is already on the device.
Add rasters and feature tables from a GeoPackage to a map.
Shows how to set the min and max scale on a map.
Set the map's reference scale and which feature layers should honor the reference scale.
Display your location history on the map.
Take a map offline using a preplanned map area.
Apply scheduled updates to preplanned map area
Apply scheduled updates to a downloaded preplanned map area.
Display a composite layer of all the subtype values in a feature class.
Display annotation from a feature service URL.
Convert features into graphics to show them with mil2525d symbols.
Apply a colormap renderer to a raster.
You can create a tiled layer using the url to the service
This sample shows how to load an offline copy of a tiled map service so that that basemap tiled service is available when applications are offline
You can create a tpk from a map service
You can use the url to a map server to create a map image layer
You can change the renderer of a sublayer in a map image layer
You can show or hide individual sublayers in a map image layer
This sample shows to add or remove map image sublayers and how to re-arrange existing sublayers in a map image layer
You can now add vector tile layers
You can define different styles for same vector tiled layer using custom stylesheets
This sample demonstrates how to display map tiles from an online resource
This sample demonstrates how to create an image service raster and apply a Hillshade raster function to it.
You can create a raster layer from a file
Show a raster layer on a map using a geopackage
You can create a raster layer from an ArcGIS Image service
You can apply hill shade renderer to a raster
The sample shows you how to use blend renderer with raster layer
The sample shows you how to use rgb renderer with raster layer
The sample shows you how to use stretch renderer with raster layer
Show labels on feature layers using JSON label definitions.
Display a WMTS layer as a basemap layer
Open a WMS layer from a URL and display it in a map
Shows how to change the style of a WMS layer.
This sample demonstrates how to execute an attribute and spatial query on the sublayers of an ArcGIS map image layer.
Symbolize a feature layer on a map using a shapefile
Show a KML file from a URL, local file, or portal item.
List the contents of a KML file.
Show a balloon popup with formatted content for tapped KML features. KML supports defining HTML for popups.
Display a KML file that loads content from a network resource.
Display a map with an OpenStreetMap basemap.
Display a layer from a WFS service, requesting only features for the current extent.
Load a WFS feature table using an XML query.
Browse a WFS service for layers and add them to the map.
Add layers to a group layer and toggle their visibility as a group.
Use annotation sublayers to gain finer control of annotation layer subtypes.
Control the rendering mode of feature layers.
Control the rendering mode of feature layers in scenes.
Show a feature layer on map using the url to the service
Show a feature layer on map using a geodatabase
Show a feature layer on a map using a geopackage
Display a feature layer on a map using a shapefile
There are different request modes you can load your feature layer in. This sample uses the "On Interaction Cache Mode".
There are different request modes you can load your feature layer in. This sample uses the "On Interaction No Cache Mode".
There are different request modes you can load your feature layer in. This sample uses the "Manual Cache Mode".
You can tap on the map to select or unselect features in a feature layer
You can query features in feature layer via service feature table. In this sample you can query for States in USA
You can set the definition expression on the feature layer to load specific features
The feature layer comes with a default renderer but you can also override this renderer using your custom renderer
The sample shows you how to take features offline
Show a feature collection layer using a URL to the service
Use a feature collection layer to show query results from a service feature table
This sample shows how to query related features for a given feature. Tap on a feature on the map to see its related features
This sample shows how to add or delete related features to an origin feature
This sample demonstrates how to apply a time-based parameter to a feature layer query
You can add graphics to a map using the new Graphics Overlay
You can add graphics to a map using the new Graphics Overlay and specify symbol for each graphic
You can use the identify method on map view to get the graphics at a location. It could be the location, user interacted with, via tap gesture or simply some custom location
You can change the drawing order of graphics in graphics overlay using the z index
You can use the sketch editor for sketching on your map
Tap on the map to get the coordinates for the location in a callout. Tap again to hide it.
Tap on the button in the toolbar to display legends for the layers on the map
This sample shows how to create a graphic with simple marker symbol
This sample shows how to create picture marker symbols from a remote image and an image in assets
This sample demonstrates how to create a simple renderer and add it to a graphics overlay
This sample demonstrate how to use a unique value renderer to style different features in a feature layer with different symbols
This sample demonstrates how to display and work with coordinate system grids such as LatitudeLongitude, MGRS, UTM and USNG on a map view
Demonstrates how to display billboarded point graphics with military symbols.
Read symbols from a mobile style
Open a mobile style (.stylx) and read its contents. Combine several symbols from the style into a single multilayer point symbol, then use it to display graphics in the map view.
Use a custom dictionary style (.stylx) to symbolize features using a variety of attribute values.
Find the location for an address.
Use an online service to find the address for a tapped point.
Find places of interest near a location or within a specific area.
Geocode addresses to locations and reverse geocode locations to addresses offline.
Construct a KML document and save it as a KMZ file.
Synchronize offline edits with a feature service.
Tap on a location on the map to add a new feature at that location
Tap on a feature to select it and then tap on the info button to delete the feature
Tap on a feature to display a callout. The callout shows the damage type for that feature and an info button. To change the damage type tap on the info button and select a new on from the list shown
Tap on a feature to display a callout. To change the geometry of the selected feature tap on the info button. Tap on the new location on the map and tap Done to save

Tap on a feature to display a callout. The callout shows the number of attachments associated with that feature. Tap on the info button to open the list view. You can add, delete or download an attachment in this list
This sample shows you how to add or edit features in an online feature layer using popups. The new popups provide inline editing for fast editing experience
The sample shows you how to take features offline, make changes and sync them back to the service
Project a point to another spatial reference.
The sample shows simple ways to create different types of geometries
The sample shows how to perform geometry operations between overlapping polygons
This sample demonstrates how to convert a map location Point to a number of different coordinate notations. Tap on the map or edit the values in textfields

This sample demonstrates how to use the transformation catalog to get a list of available datum transformations that can be used to project a geometry between two different spatial references, and how to use one of the transformations to perform the geometry engine's "project" operation.
Use geometry engine to calculate a geodesic path between two points and measure its distance.
This sample demonstrates how to cut a geometry with a polyline using the GeometryEngine. For example, you may want to subdivide a large parcel polygon into several smaller parcels.
This sample demonstrates how to clip a geometry with an envelope using the geometry engine.
This sample demonstrates how to use the AGSGeometryEngine to evaluate the spatial relationships between geometries.
Apply densify and generalize functions to polyline geometry.
Create buffers around the tap location with a given radius.
Create a convex hull for a given set of points.
Find the closest vertex and coordinate of a geometry to a point.
Find closest facility to an incident (interactive)
Find a route to the closest facility from a location.

The sample comes loaded with start and end stops. Tap on the Route button to solve for route between these stops. On completion the route is displayed on the map and the directions button is enabled. Tap on the button to see the list of directions
Add stops and barriers to the map, set the route parameters and tap route. A route will be shown connecting the stops with a list of directions
Tap on the map to add the first stop. Add additional stops to display the route. To route 'on the fly' tap, hold and move to show the route dynamically.
This samples shows how to find service areas around a point
Find closest facility to multiple incidents (service)
Find routes from several locations to the respective closest facility.
Use a routing service to navigate between two points.
This sample demonstrates how to execute a geoprocessing task to calculate a hotspot analysis based on the frequency of 911 calls.
This sample demonstrates how to query a feature table to get aggregated statistics back for a specific field.
This sample demonstrates how to query a feature table to get statistics for one or more specified fields. The results can be grouped and sorted using one or more fields in the table.
This sample demonstrates how to calculate a viewshed using a geoprocessing service.
Shows how to create a location viewshed from a camera.
Demonstrates how to interactively edit a viewshed analysis in a scene and see updates on-the-fly.
Demonstrates how to construct a viewshed so that it updates automatically relative to a moving GeoElement.
Place a line of sight between two locations.
Line of sight between an observer and a moving GeoElement
Demonstrates measuring 3D distances between two points in a scene.
Shows a list of users in a portal group.
Shows how to search for webmaps within a portal using a keyword.
Connect to an IWA secured portal and search for maps.
Authenticate with ArcGIS Online (or your own portal) using OAuth2 to access secured resources, such as private web maps or layers.
Access a web map that is secured with ArcGIS token-based authentication.
Get the elevation for a given point on a surface in a scene.
Set the terrain surface with elevation described by a raster file.
Create terrain surface from a local raster
Set the terrain surface with elevation described by a local tile package.
Create terrain surface from a local tile package
This sample shows you how to open a web scene from a portal item.
The sample shows you how to display a scene with elevation data
The sample shows you how to render graphics extruded in z direction
The sample shows how to create symbols with different 3D shapes
The sample shows how to position graphics using different surface placements
The sample shows how to use a scene layer in a scene
This sample demonstrates how to update the orientation of graphics in graphics overlay using expressions on scene properties
This sample demonstrates how to animate a graphic’s position and rotation and have the camera follow it

Demonstrates how to create a graphic using a distance composite scene symbol. Distance composite scene symbols can render different symbols depending on the distance between the camera and the graphic.
This sample demonstrates how to use terrain exaggeration on a surface in a scene
This sample demonstrates how to apply extrusion to a renderer on a feature layer
This sample demonstrates how to identify geoelements in a scene layer.
Demonstrates how to keep the viewpoints of two map or scene views in sync with each other.
Change the appearance of the atmosphere in a scene.
View an integrated mesh layer from a scene service.
View content beneath the terrain surface
See through terrain in a scene and move the camera underground.
View a point scene layer from a scene service
Opens and displays a scene from a Mobile Scene Package (.mspk).
Control the behavior of the camera in a scene.
Discover connected features in a utility network using connected, subnetwork, upstream, and downstream traces.
Run a filtered trace to locate operable features that will isolate an area from the flow of network resources.
Tap on real-world objects to collect data.
Use augmented reality (AR) to pin a scene to a table or desk for easy exploration.
Use augmented reality (AR) to quickly explore a scene more naturally than you could with a touch or mouse interface.
